title: What does Vi's name stand for?
body:
I noticed that some of the champions in League of Legends have names that are shortened forms of longer names. I mean, Vayne's full name is Shauna Vayne, Garen's is Garen Crownguard, and Lux's name is short for Luxanna. 

But what is Vi's actual name (as opposed to nickname)? Victoria? Vivian? 

I really want to know; does anyone here know and therefore can back me up with some info?

replies.body:
It stands for Jarvan VI

in other words, Vi is Jarvan's long lost granddaughter

The first two are just their full names instead of their name (and also Lux is a crownguard.)

As for Vi, she hasn't got a name other then Vi that we know of, she possibly had another name, but in the league world people tend to go by whatever name they actually choose.

> [{quoted}](name=JasonWazza,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=EmyIh3GQ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-07-23T13:48:29.827+0000)
>
> The first two are just their full names instead of their name (and also Lux is a crownguard.)
Yeah, I know that.  Some champions have full names; Malcolm Graves comes to mind.

> As for Vi, she hasn't got a name other then Vi that we know of, she possibly had another name, but in the league world people tend to go by whatever name they actually choose.
Hopefully the guys at Rito may give her one when they make a visual update of her (I see that they are busy redesigning champions)

Nearly all the champions do have a full name, most just aren't used in game (because do you really want the full names for everything?

As for Vi it's unlikely she will get more of a name then she has now.

Vi stands for Violence. Lux is light. Brand is flame or fire or something. I'm not kidding. I can't remember where I found this though. If I find it I'll link. I think Nasus is Susan backwards which is one of the people who made him or something- not sure if correct but I'm pretty sure that has something to do with Susan.
Also Udyr means beast. But that's not the point.
Dyr is Danish for Expensive so Udyr probably means cheap. Coz he is. Fk him.
No udyr really does mean beast. There's probably a lot of relations to each thing like what you said with Brand. Both are right. It does mean flame and probably is what you just said.

Lux aeterna is Latin for Eternal Light (lux-light, Aeterna-eternal).

A Brand is a burn scar of a symbol.

This is the league of uninspired character names what do you expect?

Pretty sure her name is the abbreviation for "Violence" as someone has already mentioned, if not the case then it would just be another noun, nothing too special.

> [{quoted}](name=SEKAI,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=EmyIh3GQ,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-07-24T03:24:57.240+0000)
>
> This is the league of uninspired character names what do you expect?
> 
> Pretty sure her name is the abbreviation for "Violence" as someone has already mentioned, if not the case then it would just be another noun, nothing too special.

I thought it would be Victoria or Vivian since the first two letters have "Vi" in it, I'm just speculating since her real name was not even divulged in canon, or in game.

She joined a gang of Criminals when she was 6 so I think they named her 6 or what are the Roman numeral for 6 = V and I. Hence Vi.

She says:

"Vi, hah, stands for violence!" 
"Vi stands for vicious." 
"Vi stands for vice."

But I think the above is the story though, but I'm not sure. (That's what it says on her Champion background on Lolwiki).

it stands for 6.
VI is 6 in roman numerals.
she has a sister called IX.
